result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodrick Cornelius Stewart

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodrick Cornelius Stewart appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Rodrick Cornelius Stewart.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  The court appointed Attorney Andrew Golden to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the conclustion of the case and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.   Defense counsel requests pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-06-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Rodrick Cornelius Stewart appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to a Reserve Judge, Branch 13. All parties are notified that effective October 31st, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37, in Room 508 of the Courthouse. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Rodrick Cornelius Stewart
Current: 4901 N 67th St., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 10011 West Hampton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/4/22 @ 2:30p
